info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued October 10 at 10:30AM MST until October 10 at 11:45AM MST by NWS Flagstaff AZ
info.description:
At 1030 AM MST, A stream gauge on Jacks Canyon reported a 6 foot rise in water at 9:30 AM MST. This high water will continue to move downstream toward Winslow over the next hour.
HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding.
SOURCE...Gauges reported.
IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, normally dry washes, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses.
Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Winslow, Sunset Pass, Jacks Canyon, Clear Creek Reservoir and Homolovi Ruins State Park.
This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 257 and 258. Business Interstate 40 between mile markers 256 and 257. State Route 99 between mile markers 39 and 41. State Route 87 between mile markers 317 and 339...and near mile marker 346.
This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Clear Creek, Cottonwood Wash, Little Colorado River and Jacks Canyon.
info.instruction:
Flooding of washes and creeks will occur, some dirt roads will become muddy and impassable. Paved roads and underpasses could become flooded as well.
Stay away or be swept away! The banks of creeks and washes are unstable and unsafe during any flooding event.

parameter.value: FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FOR JACKS CANYON UNTIL 1145 AM MST THIS MORNING FOR COCONINO AND NAVAJO COUNTIES
